title: Why Margaret Thatcher is this season's secret style muse
text:
You don’t need to see an image of Margaret Thatcher in order to picture her. There’s the power suit of course, the pussy-bow blouse, often a string of pearls and she was almost always carrying a frame handbag.

Six years on from her death and 40 years since she first moved into Downing Street, Britain’s longest-serving Prime Minister of the 20th century remains a divisive figure, but it is impossible to deny that her coordinated, power-suited aesthetic was memorable.

As our first - and until Theresa May’s recent tenure, only - female Prime Minister, she inspired a generation of women that they too could be leaders, and they didn’t need to dress like men to do so.
